meanings.definition: A round, hollow flatbread that can be split open to hold fillings.
meanings.sent1: I filled the pita with hummus and vegetables.
meanings.sent2: The pita bread at the restaurant was soft and warm.
meanings.sent3: The pita bread told a joke and made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The pita bread was a cozy blanket wrapping around the delicious filling.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked pita filled the kitchen.

meanings.definition: A pocket in a pita bread that can be filled with various ingredients.
meanings.sent1: The pita pocket was stuffed with chicken and lettuce.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the flavors of the pita pocket filled with falafel.
meanings.sent3: The pita pocket danced around the plate, entertaining the guests.
meanings.sent4: The pita pocket was a treasure chest of tasty surprises.
meanings.sent5: The colorful ingredients spilled out of the pita pocket.

meanings.definition: To bake or heat pita bread.
meanings.sent1: I will pita the bread before serving it.
meanings.sent2: She pitaed the pita bread in the oven until it was warm.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally pitaed the bread for too long, making it crispy.
meanings.sent4: The warmth of the pitaed bread filled the room with a comforting smell.
meanings.sent5: He carefully pitaed the bread to perfection.
